THOMAS WAS ALONE - A beautiful, minimalist indie 2D puzzle/platformer.    || 8.5 || Score Comment   Graphics 8 Simple but pleasing, using clean lines and shapes to form the game levels. Game Characters are also simple shapes with different colours but are easily identifiable. Background colours and effects have a different pallet for each level. The overall effect is minimalist, stylish and elegant.    Audio 10 Relaxing ambient background music throughout the game and excellent story narration by Danny Wallace (He won a BAFTA for his performance). There really is nothing to fault here.   Gameplay 9 Thomas was alone has simple and intuitive controls that respond well, giving good control of your characters. Levels start simply and get progressively more difficult at a fairly steady rate. I don't ever recall feeling overwhelmed at any point and play remained very enjoyable throughout the game. As you progress the game does a good job of introducing you to new concepts that you need to complete the levels like controlling various elements (doors, gravity, etc) through various pressure and trigger switches. Also as you progress you meet and gain control of other characters (besides Thomas) each of which have their own unique properties and abilities. You will often find that you will need to employ skill & logic as well as a bit of trial and error to successful navigate levels but fortunately the game does not punish you for failing, so play always seems fun.   Story 9 I really didn't expect any kind of story from a puzzle platform game, especially not one where the characters are just little shapes, but despite this what I got was a brilliant one. A delightful little story that builds with each level and makes you really care about what happens to your little shapes. Each one has their own unique characters, fears, desires and personalities. Their struggles to survive and escape the unfair system that imprisons them and which is constantly changing the rules in its efforts to defeat them.   Replayability 6 By the end of the game you will have mastered some pretty advanced skills and will remember many of the puzzles solutions, this makes some of the earlier levels feel very easy. The game is of a fairly good length but because its so enjoyable you will no doubt be left wanting more. There are various steam achievements (small black hollow rectangles) scattered throughout various levels and going back to find these will add to the playtime. Levels are re-playable after you have completed them making it a good game for quick casual play.   Overall 8.5 A little gem of an indie game, charming and enjoyable, it leaves you wanting more - would highly recommend.  More reviews by Fancy FishAgree / Disagree? Please leave me a comment below

SHADOWRUN RETURNS - Cyberpunk adventure/rpg with a compelling story   || 8 || Score Comment   Graphics 7 The game has top down isometric type view, graphics are very well done: the lighting, effects and areas feel very fitting and atmospheric.  At points, however, it feels like it would be nice to have a little bit more variety to the areas, some of them feel quite samey. Character creation and portraits are ok but you can't go into the level of detail of some other RGPs.  Audio 7 Music and sound effects are good, there is however quite a bit of reading to do in this game, do not expect voice acting for all of the story / dialogue.  Gameplay 8 I really enjoyed playing this game, its a nice mixture of adventure / mystery and rpg with turn based strategic combat (think xcom). You control a small team of characters (you collect them as the story progresses) who follow you as you play through the story completing various missions and solving mysteries. There are some good puzzles to solve as the story develops and you can choose to upgrade various skills as your character advances in levels. A really nice feature is the "hacking" that the decker class can perform, this takes a form similar to combat in the game but its you and your constructs against the computer systems defences.    Story 8 Shadowrun Returns is set in cyberpunk-esque world where magic meets machine. You can play different stories in the form of campaigns, the official ones are complemented by community created ones via the steam workshop. The campaigns are extremely well done and have a very noir feel to them. There's a lot of background and detail to the world (and a lot of reading to be done) and the story had enough intrigue and action to keep me interested right to the end. The nature of the game (your characters acting out the story) basically means that play feels quite linear and that sometimes the decisions you make don't really have lasting effects but this didn't effect my enjoyment too much.    Replayability 5 As much of the main campaign is story based, once you have completed the game there isn't that much to draw you back in. Having said that there is an excellent DLC (dragonfall) and there are community created campaigns and an editor which should add quite a few hours of playability   Overall 8 Excellent game for anyone who loves this style of gameplay or the setting. The community content really adds a whole new aspect and lease of life to the game, just be prepared to do a lots of reading.  More reviews by Fancy FishAgree / Disagree? Please leave me a comment

THE SECRET OF MONKEY ISLAND: SPECIAL EDITION - A LucasArts Classic beautifully and masterfully reworked  || 9 || Score Comment   Graphics 8 Simply stunning, switching between the original graphics and the special edition you can really appreciate the time the artists have taken to faithful reproduce the backgrounds, characters and animations.  Audio 9 Excellent music (I mean come on! its monkey Island I don't think I will ever get that tune out of my head) and really well done voice acting for all the characters. Gameplay 10 Ok, first I admit I am completely biased here: I love Monkey Island. Back from the days when I first got it to run on my 268 (I know showing my age) this game was something special. Monkey Island is one of the classic games from the golden age of point and click adventure games where LucasArts and Sierra ruled supreme with games like Day of the Tentacle, Sam & Max and the Kings Quest series. The controls have been reworked, making them more user friendly for a modern audience, but are still faithful to the original and don't detract from the game in anyway. Even if you weren't old enough to appreciate these games the first time round they are masterpieces and I feel stand the test of time.   Story 10 The game is pretty much all about the story (a truly amazing story), and while you are free to do some exploring around the islands and some trial and error with the puzzles, the story is essentially linear (so don't expect an open world game). The dialogue is full of dry humour and the situations (and solutions to puzzles) fantastical, absurd and brilliant. While the story has many aspects that will appeal to younger players (slapstick humor), much of the humour will appeal to adults. The puzzles are challenging but not to the point of frustration and are worked into the story well.   Replayability 7 If you have played the game its likely to be memorable enough that you will know the solutions to the puzzles, but its still good fun, and was for me very nostalgic.   Overall 9 Completely biased review, take from it what you will, but we all have childhood games special to us and this was mine. Good times More reviews by Fancy FishAgree / Disagree? Please leave me a comment below

AGE OF WONDERS III - Good Turn based tactical combat, Hero RPG elements and Empire building 4X strategy  || 8 || Score Comment   Graphics 8 Nice graphics and detail on the strategic map and even better graphics for units, terrain and magical effects in combat. UI is nice, detailed and easy to use  Audio 6 Music gets a little repetitive - maybe a little more variety needed, sound effects are good but nothing special. Gameplay 8 Age of Wonders III is a turn based, 4X strategy game based in a fantasy setting. The tactical combat view (when your army's battle) is excellent, you really feel like you are head to head with the AI (which seems to do a good job most of the time) in a battle of wits. Casting a well timed spell or outmanoeuvring your enemy can sometimes turn the tide of a battle, unfortunately usually the outcome of a battle is a forgone conclusion due to the relative strength of the units involved, but even when this is the case its still fun to crush your enemy and minimise your losses. The strength of the Units in your army really plays such a large part of the battles that you can actually choose to skip the tactical battle entirely and have the computer automatically calculate the results. Some of the units have somewhat of a balance issue with the higher level units often being able to take down whole armies by themselves with little damage or risk. This inevitably results in a race to upgrade your city buildings to create these higher level creatures. AI at the strategic level is a little predictable but there is still fun to be had placing your cities and grabbing as many resources as possible to fund your economy. One thing I noticed at the strategic level is there doesn't seem to be any downside to city spamming (covering the map in loads of your cities) as you gain resources (mana, gold, research) for each city. Ruins, shrines and artefacts are scattered throughout the maps and these will often require you to fight a monster to claim the reward for your Hero. Hero's are your army leaders you get a main one and then can hire more for gold. Hero's have a selection of spells they can use to aid you in battle, summon monsters or benefit your cities. Items you collect / make can be given to your hero's to increase their stats and they also get skills as they earn xp through battles.   Story 7 The game contains a number of well written scenario's which are fairly fun to play through. Overall I think I preferred playing the random maps though.   Replayability 7 If you enjoy the game you will probably want to play it again, random maps and steam workshop adds more community made content.   Overall 8 A fan of this genre will probably get a lot of enjoyment out of this game. While not as complex or detailed as others of the same type what it does it does well. Hotseat mode (a mode I loved from Civilisation) is a great addition to this game and playing with friends is a lot of fun. More reviews by Fancy FishAgree / Disagree? Please leave me a comment below

SID MEIER'S CIVILISATION V - Just one more turn?  || 9 || Score Comment   Graphics 8 Visuals are simple but pleasing, good textures on the landscape tiles, nicely detailed units with lots of variety, good animations and an intuitive unobtrusive UI.  Zooming in and out on units, cities and terrain allows you see all the little  details while also giving you the ability to see the "big picture" strategic view. Graphics are vastly improved from previous games in the series. If I had one wish I guess it would be to have your cities and their buildings represented better visually. Cities grow and spread with population and advance with technology/era and have several different styles depending on the nation you select, and the building of wonders will add the wonder to the area surrounding your city but it would be great to have further customisation of your cities so you could really make them your own. The Civilopedia (like an in game wiki) is a little difficult to navigate and while informative could use some work.  Audio 8 Game Music is relaxing and fitting, from the dawn of civilisation, the age of exploration or the grand age of empire building it just seems to work well and I very rarely feel the need to turn down the music volume (as I do with other games). The ambient sound is excellent, move your screen to a coastal area and you will hear the wash of the sea, select your boats and you will here the crack of oars or ring of their bell. The little touches and details like these really make the game a joy to play.  Gameplay 9 Civilisation is a turn based 4X (eXplore, eXpand, eXploit, eXterminate) game, a game of grand strategy & micromanagement, a game where the objective is to grown your civilisation and eventually conquer all through Technology, Culture, Diplomacy and Military might. This is by no means a simple game, it takes time to truly learn and fully appreciate but once you get into a game your hooked. Civilisation is by far the most addictive game (maybe with the exception of certain MMORGP's) out there. The "just one more turn" is a running joke because you will often find yourself planning on playing just one more turn to build something or win a battle and then you will look to the clock and find several hours have past. The start of the game is exciting, turns move quickly and you see your planning quickly realised, mid game you must continue your expansion and put in place what you will need to win. The only place where I feel this game falls down is late in the game, by this point sometimes there will be a clear winner, technology advancement will slow and your empire will often be so massive and units so numerous that just taking your turn can take quite a lot of time. Overall though gameplay is outstanding. The AI can be a little quirky at times but for the most part is challenging and tactically sound. Relationships between civilisations are all based on their predisposition and events which occur throughout the game and can therefore be somewhat predictable.   Story 8 The Story of history rewritten, the story of civilisation, so many details make up this game and so much background history on every aspect (via the civilopedia). The DLC add's on (amongst other things) quests which add to the story but in truth these add little to the game. The narrative is really what you make it, the interaction between the leaders of the other civilisations, all struggling for power, the alliances and conflicts mean there is very rarely a time of true peace or a dull moment.    Replayability 10 Fully customisable random maps, different scenarios, different civilisations and leaders. Make your own maps and scenarios, full integrated into steam workshop with hundreds of brilliant mods. It all adds up to a different experience each time and near infinite replayability.    Multiplayer 6 This is not an easy game to play multiplayer, the nature of the game means that you will all need a large amount of time to play a game through to completion, which may be problematic (especially with friends in different timezones or for people with connection issues). The most enjoyable aspect of multiplayer I found was the hotseat mode. In this mode you play locally and multiple players take the game in turns (like a boardgame), once again the time required to get near the end means you could be in for a very long (but very enjoyable) game.   Overall 9 While some purists will prefer the earlier Civ games in the series, I feel that Civ 5 (and especially with the main DLCs) is a worthy successor. It has the right level of difficulty and depth, much improved visuals and solid gameplay which will make you wonder where the hours went.  More reviews by Fancy FishAgree / Disagree? This game has mixed reviews mainly because of its early-access tricks it pulled. This is very important to note when looking at these reviews. People are pissed off because they payed $80+ during the kickstarter, and only got what they were promised much, much later. With that being said, this is actually a decent game. It has gone on sale for $10 or less, and at these prices it is definetly worth picking up. Although it took a long time to get there, it is currently a decent RTS, and is a bloody lot of fun to play as well. The premise of the game is simple. Annihilate. Having such a simple goals keeps the gameplay quite elementary, but allows it to focus on different mechanics. You are constantly at war with whatever other player/AI found themselves in your vicinity, and you will not rest until their planet lies in shambles. And you can literally do that! By nuking them into oblivion, crashing a moon into them or just blowing them up death-star style, planets can be severly damaged or even permanently wiped off of the map! Note: Your friends will get pissed at you if you use an annihilaser on them. Use with caution. The gameplay is also simple. There are 5 kinds of units: air, bots, vehicles, naval and orbital. These pretty much do what they say on the tin, and certain things are best used in specific situations (although bots and vehicles are pretty much interchangable). By creating an army (the biggest usually wins), you constantly attack your opponents base, destroying their resources or factories and giving you an adavantage. The game is won as soon as you kill their commander, while they are trying to do the same to you. If you start out on the same planet (and there are other planets in the system), you can transport or teleport your commander to those planets, only to start a new base and keep him safer. Establish orbital control to stop any hostile orbital fabrication bots from building teleporters and unleashing their entire army upon you. Its a lot of fun, and really easy to get into (*cough* Europa Universalis IV *cough*).Overall, you should definetly get the game if it is on sale. If not, probably best to buy only if you enjoy the RTS genre. It is a lot of fun to play with friends as well as alone, although there are some bugs here and there which are still being patched. I have not found anything gamebreaking so far though, so I think it should be okay. Anyway, it is a good game, and although it did not deliver well during early access (and after launch as well), it is worth picking up now.

Wow, just wow. This game is absolutely incredible. It tells a deep, rich story through the use of signs, which also give you slight hints at the puzzles you are trying to solve. In the beginning of the game, it is more or less "Wow, look at our crazy physics", but later it becomes a true puzzle game. You'll find yourself on other sides of the map by just going through a door, you'll find new ways to solve puzzles by using new tools, you'll find paths that were always there, but you never realised them. It is quite short, but it is a must-play.

With 1.0 coming out tomorrow, there is absolutely no possible reason not to get this game. This is already one of the best games out there, even with it being in early access, and it is bound to get even better. This game allows you to carefully plan a mission, build a rocket and then launch that rocket only to have it spectacularly blow up during a staging procedure. KSP has the potential of being an incredibly in-depth game, while also being a hilarious, mess-em-up explosion bonanza. It is so versatile, and it offers many, many mods to keep you coming back over and over again. Also, the developers have their own platform for modding, and intend to keep away from the paid-mod pile of asshattery. This game is worth 3x its current price. Get it.

Horizon Zero Dawn, one of a few Sony exclusives to get a PC port, a great game in a beautiful package. Already got the platinium on the PS4 Pro version (25h for the story/50h if you want the 100%, DLC is on another map and takes around 15h.)Horizon Zero Dawn is a classic 3rd person view open world with a great story (including the DLC too), on the graphics side it's one of the most beautiful games of the PS4 (beaten by TLOU2 and RDR2).In my opinion Horizon Zero Dawn is a mixture between Tomb Raider (3rd person view, gameplay mechanics, craft), FarCry Primal (atmosphere), The Witcher 3 (3rd person view, atmosphere, RPG mechanics), and some Assassins Creed (3rd person view, climbing).The story takes place in the 31st century and follows Aloy. The world is dominated by robotics creatures : the "machines", humans on the other sides try to survive in different small groups.Aloy is a hunter trying to discover what happen to mankind, especially why the machines are becoming more aggressive over the years and on the other side why humans have such limited access to technology.Gameplay is where this game is really good, the battles against the machines are a lot of fun and got a lot of possibilities (especially the big one like the Thunderjaw or Stormbird), combats with humans are on the other side really poor.The games has no vehicle except that Aloy can ride some machines like a horse (yay).The game has a lot of collectibles, but there are not required to progress in the story.OST and sounds are also great.The game consumes a lot GPU power, Ryzen 3700X + 32Gb RAM + GTX1080 here and I got like 45fps average with the high settings on a 21/9 screen at 3440*1440.For the moment it also got a lot of stuttering, and it crash randomly (I bet a patch we'll be released soon).You can expect to gain some FPS if you tweak some useless options (wait for a full guide like RDR2 got), or to the devs to increase the performance.https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2190247414At 50‚Ç¨ if you are looking for this game since it was released on the PS4 or if you want a great story/gameplay/graphics then it's worth it. If not, then wait for a discount.Overall this game is my TOP5 PS4 exclusive games, among God Of War, TLOU2, Ghost of Tsushima, and Days Gone, maybe one day we'll get these on Steam.TL, DR:---{Graphics}---‚òê You forget what reality is‚òë Beautiful‚òê Good‚òê Decent‚òê Bad‚òê Don‚Äòt look too long at it‚òê MS-DOS---{Gameplay}---‚òë Very good‚òê Good‚òê It‚Äòs just gameplay‚òê Mehh‚òê Watch paint dry instead‚òê Just don't---{Audio}---‚òê Eargasm‚òë Very good‚òê Good‚òê Not too bad‚òê Bad‚òê I'm now deaf---{Audience}---‚òê Kids‚òê Teens‚òê Adults‚òë All (no blood, no executions in the game)---{PC Requirements}---‚òê Check if you can run paint‚òê Potato‚òê Decent‚òê Fast‚òë Rich boi (If you except to play at 1440p, hope you got at least a 2070/5700)‚òê Ask NASA if they have a spare computer---{Difficulity}---‚òê Just press 'W'‚òê Easy‚òë Significant brain usage‚òê Easy to learn / Hard to master‚òê Difficult‚òê Dark Souls---{Grind}---‚òê Nothing to grind‚òê Only if u care about leaderboards/ranks‚òê Isnt necessary to progress‚òë Average grind level‚òê Too much grind‚òê You‚Äòll need a second live for grinding---{Story}---‚òê No Story‚òê Some lore‚òê Average‚òê Good‚òë Lovely‚òê It‚Äòll replace your life---{Game Time}---‚òê Long enough for a cup of coffee‚òê Short‚òë Average‚òê Long‚òê To infinity and beyond---{Price}---‚òê It‚Äôs free!‚òë Worth the price‚òê If u have some spare money left‚òê Not recommended‚òê You could also just burn your money---{Bugs}--- (will be edited when patched)‚òê Never heard of‚òê Minor bugs‚òë Can get annoying‚òê ARK: Survival Evolved‚òê The game itself is a big terrarium for bugs

Dear god please give me a new pair of balls for christmas, the 919 is pure madness, it's too (JUST TOO !!!) fast and you can't see trought the windshield. Just Cause 3Comme je viens de finir le jeu √† 100%, je vous propose une review pour ceux qui serait tent√©s. J'ai eu le jeu gratuitement avec l'achat d'un CPU Intel, mais j'avais d√©j√† jou√© √† Just Cause 1 et 2 pour info.La version PCCommencement par le plus utile (et aussi le plus path√©tique) : l'optimisation du titre est absolument ATROCE.D√©j√† si votre PC n'a pas plus de 8go de RAM n'achetez pas ce jeu si vous visez l'ultra. (Les d√©veloppeurs l'ont confirm√© le jeu d√©passe la conso des 8go annonc√©s sur la fiche de steam, le seul moyen d'arriver √† faire fonctionner correctement le bousin est d'avoir 16go sinon bonjour le stuterring √† gogo).Passer ce d√©tail le jeu est tr√®s gourmand pour un rendu loin d'√™tre photor√©aliste mais plut√¥t joli dans l'ensemble avec des paysages tr√®s sympas pour les fans de screenshots.En ultra/1080p avec une config √† base de 4790K + 290X + 16go de RAM : j'obtiens en moyenne 80-90FPS avec des chutes √† 50 quand il pleut ou qu'il y a beaucoup d'explosions. L'utilisation du i7 est de l'ordre de 60%, la RAM est dans les 11go utilis√© (oui vous avez bien lu, sans aucun autre programme lanc√© :D).Autre info int√©ressante que j'ai remarqu√© r√©cemment : le jeu d√©teste √™tre lanc√© avec un pad de 360 branch√© au lancement.  En faisant √ß√† le jeu √† d'√©normes fuites de m√©moire et la conso de RAM monte jusqu'√† 100% puis crash (m√™me en ayant un SWAP de 40go sur SSD). Seul moyen de contourner le probl√®me : brancher sa manette une fois le jeu charg√© compl√®tement.Le soloL'histoire du jeu m√™me si elle est extr√™mement vu et revu est plut√¥t sympa : Rico (le gentil) vient en aide √† son peuple contre le m√©chant dictateur local DiRavello qui s√©vit sur l'ile. Tel un sauveur Rico va devoir lib√©rer l'ile au fur et √† mesure et vaincre le m√©chant dictateur. Outre les missions principales, Just Cause 3 propose une flop√©e d'avant-postes et de villes √† lib√©r√© ainsi que des missions al√©atoires et une grosse quantit√© de collectibles et d√©fi (courses terrestres/avions/bateau, wingsuit, d√©truire une base avec tel arme en faisant le meilleur score etc...).Le jeu propose un syst√®me de progression o√π l'on peut am√©liorer son √©quipement. Le probl√®me que j'ai trouv√© est que si vous voulez d√®s le d√©but du jeu r√©ussir √† faire les meilleurs scores pour d√©bloquer le plus de m√©canismes (le syst√®me de points du jeu) vous devez avoir les meilleures voitures/bateaux/armes qui sont accessibles uniquement √† la fin :/Du coup j'ai fini l'histoire avant de m'attaquer aux d√©fis.Le jeu dispose d'un nombre cons√©quent de v√©hicules : voitures, motos, bateaux, h√©licopt√®res, avions... La physique des v√©hicules terrestres est tr√®s rigide et absolument immonde en hors-piste : hors de question d'arriver √† g√©rer les bosses d'une route de campagne en allant trop vite. Les h√©licos et les avions sont cependant tr√®s simple √† prendre en main tout comme la wingsuit de Rico.Dur√©e de vieJust Cause √©tant un open-world, la dur√©e de vie est typique de ce genre de jeu : l'histoire prend environ 10-12h √† √™tre fini auquel on ajoute environ 5h de collectibles √† r√©cup√©rer, 5h de plus pour r√©cup√©rer tous les v√©hicules (dont certains sont bien cach√©s et difficiles √† r√©cup√©rer) et 10-15h de d√©fis. Au final le jeu souffre du m√™me probl√®me que Mad Max (du m√™me studio) : un solo sympa mais trop de qu√™tes Fedex qui deviennent lassantes et r√©p√©titives.Point int√©ressant, le syst√®me de largage de v√©hicules qui rend possible le spawn √† des lieux qui √©taient r√©serv√©s √† des trainers auparavant : qui ne r√™ve pas de descendre du plus haut point de l'ile √† moto ?Bande sonJust Cause 3 √† une VF qui est trop caricatur√©e au niveau des personnages de mon point de vue. Les musiques sont cependant tr√®s sympa et en phase avec l'environnement.On ne le r√©p√©tera jamais assez : si vous n'avez pas la config recommand√©e passer votre chemin sous peine de le regretter, personnellement avec une config plut√¥t muscl√©e je me suis bien amus√© sur Just Cause 3 c'est pourquoi je le note en positif.Points +- L'ile est immense- Tr√®s fun √† jouer- Un bon d√©fouloir, √ßa p√™te de partout !- De jolis paysages- Le syst√®me de spawn de v√©hicules/armes- Un choix important de v√©hicules et armes (petite pens√©e au RPG au bavarium :D)Points -- L'optimisation totalement honteuse pour un jeu en 2015-2016.- Conso de RAM √©norme- Rendu trop "simple" pour la consommation du jeu- Jeu trop r√©p√©tif √† terminer √† 100%- La mentalit√© du studio qui pr√©f√®re pr√©parer les DLC au lieu de fixer ce foutu jeuNOTE GLOBAL - 6.5/10 // Un jeu avec un potentiel √©norme gach√© par une optimisation digne d'un Assasin's Creed Unity et dont le studio se fout royalement.Histoire - 6/10Gameplay - 9/10Graphismes - 7/10Physique - 4/10Audio - 7/10I.A. - 5/10

Un concept int√©ressant entach√© par beaucoup de points noirsAyant fait tous les Call Of Duty depuis leur cr√©ation en 2003, j'ai longtemps h√©sit√© (et attendu de payer au final celui-ci 25‚Ç¨) car le c√¥t√© futuriste ne m'a jamais enchant√©. Je me consid√®rerai comme un vieux de la vielle, qui maintient que Call Of Duty doit rester une s√©rie faisant appel √† des conflits militaires et non √† un esp√®ce de mix futuriste entre Titanfall, Crysis et Destiny.Le soloTout d'abord commen√ßons par le commencement, le solo qui sans √™tre exceptionnel √† le m√©rite d'exister. La grosse annonce d'Activision fut sans aucun doute la pr√©sence de l'acteur Kevin Spacey qui joue un des principaux protagonistes. L'ensemble est plut√¥t classique (cette fois-ci on saute l'habituel USA VS Russie pour se concentrer sur le monde VS une bo√Æte priv√©e). L'histoire est tr√®s lin√©aire, et contrairement aux autres Call Of Duty est TROP bourrine, dans la dizaine de missions propos√©es il n'y a pas une seule qui requiert de l'infiltration √† la mani√®re de Modern Warfare sur la mission se d√©roulant √† Pripiat.Le tr√®s gros probl√®me du solo est justement caus√© par cette impression. Plus on avance dans l'histoire, plus celle de Modern Warfare 2 se r√©p√®te; √† savoir le gentil alli√© qui se retrouve enfaite √™tre le pire salopard, coucou G√©n√©ral Shepard !Enfin je noterais que le solo est propos√© √† la mani√®re d'un film Hollywoodien, SAUF que la fin n'est pas du tout en corr√©lation et manque tellement de th√©√¢tralit√© qui est la recette majeure d'un Call Of Duty (oui vous savez les trucs improbables qui n'arrivent que dans Call Of Duty).Le multilParlons maintenant de l'aspect essentiel d'un Call Of Duty (depuis Modern Warfare) : le multijoueur (parce que oui, jusqu'√† COD 3 le solo √©tait la pi√®ce ma√Ætresse). Activision a vendu son jeu comme plus fun, plus nerveux avec son gameplay futuriste, sauf qu'au final c'est tout le contraire. Au d√©but on se sent un peu d√©boussol√©, et le titre demande un temps d'adaptation pour le maitriser.Les modes de jeux restent classiques (avec les traditionnelles TDM/Domination mais √©galement des nouveaux modes plut√¥t sympa comme liaison satellite/avantage), sauf que les maps ne se pr√™tent pas toute bien √† ces nouveaux modes. Le syst√®me de customisation est plut√¥t bien pens√©, et le jeu propose un ensemble plut√¥t cons√©quent d'armes et accessoires. Sauf qu'on aimerait bien moins de truc qui ruine l'exp√©rience de jeu comme les lance-grenades ou autres d√©tecteurs de vis√©e.Le probl√®meVous devez-vous dire je fais finalement l'apologie de ce Call Of Duty et pourtant je le note s√©v√®rement, et bien en r√©alit√© tout n'est pas rose. Tout d'abord ce jeu souffre d'un tr√®s vieux probl√®me : pas de serveurs d√©di√©s. Ce qui fait qu'on se retrouve p√©nalis√© par un syst√®me hybride de P2P qui par moments offre de magnifiques d√©calages entre ce qu'on prend dans la tronche et ce qu'on voit dans la killcam. Avec l'argent que g√©n√®re cette s√©rie on peut se demander pourquoi depuis le temps ce n'est toujours pas r√©gl√© et on pourra remercier au passage Activision de sa politique des prix et le fait de vendre des DLC remplis de skins tous plus useless les uns que les autres. D'ailleurs on en rajoutera une couche avec le zombie qui se retrouve payant comme par magie.Ensuite le moteur graphique est toujours aussi primitif. Eh oui, les saccades, freezes et stuttering sont de la partie. De plus le jeu supporte tr√®s mal le multi-GPU (SLI ou CrossFire), ce qui a pour effet de rallonger les temps de chargements des maps et provoque de nombreux micros-lags extr√™mement chiants. L'autre incoh√©rence vient du fait d'avoir brid√© le multijoueur √† 91FPS, ce qui fait que les possesseurs d'√©cran 120/144hz (ou CRT si vous √™tes nostalgique^^) peuvent aller se coucher. Pourtant le jeu a √©t√© vendu comme un Battlefield-killer (au niveau graphique) et pourtant m√™me en Ultra le jeu reste tr√®s moyen avec un aliasing tr√®s prononc√©. Je ne parle pas non plus de l'optimisation du moteur physique qui arrive √† pousser un i5 4670K@4.4Ghz √† 100% de charges pendant les chargements.Certains se demandent aussi pourquoi des mecs gueulent √† cause d'aimbot ? Simple : prendre une manette et activer la vis√©e automatique qui fait tout le travail pour vous.La communaut√© en jeu est d√©plorable, le jeu se voulait fun et nerveux et bien c'est tout le contraire. Les √©quipiers ne connaissent g√©n√©ralement pas le mot objectif mais plut√¥t celui de camping (les tentes c'est chez Decathlon plut√¥t). Les spawns sont √©galement tr√®s foireux, combien de fois me suis-je retrouv√© √† spawner √† 2 m√®tres d'un type.Enfin je terminerais par l'√©quilibrage des armes du multijoueur qui est catastrophique, les armes lasers (l'EM1 en t√™te) sont tellement puissants qu'ils rivalisent avec quasiment tout (du pistolet au fusil de pr√©cision) et ne parlons pas de l'ASM1 avec laquelle j'arrive √† d√©foncer des snipers √† plus de 100 m√®tres.Ah et j'oubliais : le jeu ne supporte pas le Eyefinity/Surround et peut-√™tre pas non plus le 21/9 nativement, donc si vous voulez jouer sur 3 √©crans ou plus (ce qui est mon cas) vous devez passer par un logiciel alternatif qui fait correctement la mise √† l'√©chelle (ceux qui sont int√©ress√©s : Widescreen Fixer) - un comble pour un jeu AAA comme celui-ci.LES PLUS- Un concept original.- Un gameplay plut√¥t sympa mais qui requiert un petit temps d'adaptation.- Le solo qui a le m√©rite d'exister.- Le multijoueur qui est assez fun √† jouer.LES MOINS- Le moteur graphique historique.- L'optimisation √† revoir totalement : lags, freezes et crashs et consommation de RAM √©norme pour les faibles qualit√©s du titre.- Le multi-GPU tr√®s mal g√©rer.- L'ATH qui bug et l'image compress√©e en Eyefinity/Surround.- L'histoire du solo trop t√©l√©phon√©, trop pr√©visible.- La limite de 91FPS en multi, on se demande pourquoi ?- Les connections, je te met 2 balles et le coup d'apr√®s tout le chargeur y passe sans aucun d√©g√¢ts.- Aucun √©quilibrage en multi, 3 ou 4 armes au-dessus de tout le reste.- La communaut√© : remplis de rageux, haineux...- Les spawns foireux qui pourrissent le gameplay.- La politique d'Activision qui se r√©sume √† : pognon, pigeon, pognon, pigeon...NOTE GLOBAL - 4/10 // Call Of Duty Advanced Warfare est un concept int√©ressant entach√© par sa technicit√© et sa communaut√© pr√©historiqueHistoire - 4/10Gameplay - 7/10Graphismes - 5.5/10Physique - 3/10Audio - 5/10I.A. - 3/10

You know how some games are so sophisticated that you have to play it more than once to truly capture it's essence?  This is definitely NOT one of them. "Thoughts Are Meant To Be Free"  DISCLAIMER - As of the time i am writing this review, i only played through one ending. As soon as i finished the game, i had the urge to write this review, the urge to share with the world how amazingly complex and mind-boggling this game is.Orwell in a way reminded me of  Papers, Please  (Which you can find my review of it  HERE ).In Orwell you will be The Big Brother. You will snoop into people's lives and find some and some less sensitive information about said people.Orwell Does not contain much gameplay, Yet it succeeds to be an amazing piece of art, Solely with it's story.Do i recommend Orwell? Absolutely.It's amazing. It's unique.  It's not for everyone. I won't recommend it though, for people who get bored easily, and look for gameplay and graphics rather than story. EDIT : So now that i managed to do all endings and basically turn the game inside out for the achievements, it's safe to say this game is a 10/10. Every single conflict you'll encounter will guarantee to have an impact on the way the story goes, making you really question which one to add to the database.There are numerous endings, each one has it's own consequences and effects on The Nation (Where the game takes place).As said earlier, get it only if you're a nut for a good, solid storyline. Otherwise, don't bother with it.

Papers, Please is a unique game that has done something only few games have done. it will test your moral compass as close to the limits as possible, it'll test your humanity, trouble solving ability and quick time reactions. Papers, Please also manages to take something that at first glance would seem a boring task, playing as  an immigration inspector in a border checkpoint, to a work of art.That's a solid 10/10. A must with or without a sale.

Let me start this review with the fact that this game is not like anything you have ever played.It does not involve shooting, car chases or any type of sports. instead,  it tells a story. I won't include any actual info about the story since it's the only thing this game has to offer. it might sound like not enough, but once you'll play this game start to finish, you'll understand what i'm talking about.The game maybe be a bit short, but it really does not need any more time to prove itself.it's just so deep and sophisticated, you will ponder it's meaning for days after you finished it.If you have time, spare cash or just looking to diverse a bit, i definitely recommend this short  game   experience..

"The Wolf Among Us" is a five episode series based on Fables (DC Comics/Vertigo), an award-winning comic book series by Bill Willingham. it is a violent, hard-boiled thriller where the characters and creatures of myth, lore and legend are real, and exist in our world. Your choices matter and will change and define the story you experience. Purchase "The Wolf Among Us":http://store.steampowered.com/app/250320/‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïêWhen it comes to quality story gameplay, you can't go wrong with Telltale Games. and "The Wolf Among Us" is no surprise to be one of the best story driven games on the market.The game takes place in Fabletown, New York, after all the fairy tales' characters had escaped the woodlands to live a modern life, leaving everything behind. You play as Sheriff Wolf Bigby, who was in the past the Big Bad Wolf from the Little Red Riding Hood story. Throughout the story you'll investigate the story of the Murder of two Prostitues -  Holly the troll and Faith (A.K.A Donkeyskin). Atmosphere The game's atmosphere is amazing. there's always this noir feeling to it and you just want to keep playing for "just 10 more minutes".StoryThe game sucks you into it's amazing atmosphere and story. It'll question your moralities and decision making abillities. You will have the option to play as the vicious bad cop, or be kind (each is satisfying on its own). You will get emotional.Whether it's the brilliant voice acting, the absolutely AMAZING writing or the fantastic story, this game is not one you will forget after you're done playing it. Graphics Simple, yet sophisticated. Cartoon-ish, which fits the game perfectly since the game's about fairy tales and stories.Not many graphic options, but it doesn't really matter in this game, where the main focus is on the story telling abillity. Final Score - 10/10This game left an impact on me. the kind of impact that, once you finished the game, you know there isn't any game like that, and you wish you could play it for the first time again. i hope Telltale will give us a  2nd season of this marvelous game. Buy it now!

"I'm not crazy... I'm just mad"‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïêMad Max, the critically acclaimed movie franchise, now has it's very own video game, and it's a really good one too!Mad Max is a post-apocalyptic action-adventure game, with a heavy emphasis on vehicular combat, in which the player takes on the role of eponymous character Mad Maxhttp://store.steampowered.com/app/234140/‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïêShort SummaryNow, when you first think about Movie-Based video games, they're often not that good (Rambo for instance. good god that was a trainwreck). But Mad Max is nothing like that. Mad Max is an absolute gorgeous game, let alone it's optimazation is great aswell, the combat is extremly fun and the driving's fun and action packed. So witout further ado, let's review this bad boy!Pros: Story is great, immersive and really lurs you in, as Max is on his journey to find his beloved car and to find some solace.The charachters are really in depth, and has their own stories and journeys.Cutscenes are well made The game's gorgeous, one of the best Wastelands i've seen in a videogame. This game is like a mashup between Fallout (Exploring locations and scavenging for supplies) and Sleeping Dogs (Same combat system, and there's an emphasis on car-to-car vehicular combat.) Lots of customisation available, starting from Max's armor and jacket, to his haircut and facial hair. there's also an incredible range customisations available for the Magnum Opus, max's signature car along the game. Great SFX and voice acting, really gives that atmospheric feeling to it. You won't run out of thing to do! there's  alot  of activities and side quests to do. Combat system is really simple and great. Well made upgrade system. you can shoot ROCKETS FROM YOUR CAR!Cons: What would seem like a big surprise for a game that is so focused about driving and cars, there's no handbrake!The ending is really anticlimatic and short, and it just sums the whole fantastic story really badly (in my opinion of course). glitches oftenly occure, although most of them are minor and not that big of a deal.So, the final rating i give for Mad Max is -  9/10 For me, Mad Max is one of the best, funnest games i've played and is on my Top 5 Games of 2015.Heavily recommended, especially when it goes on sale for  20$ .

Agent 47 is at it again!‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê Hitman: Absolution‚Ñ¢  is the fifth installment to the Hitman franchise, starring the legend himself, Agent 47.http://store.steampowered.com/app/203140/‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïêSo here are the Pros and Cons for Hitman: Absolution‚Ñ¢ Pros: Great Voice Acting Beautiful Graphics Doing Challenges is rewarding and challenging Online leaderboards to compete with your friends and become the best assassin of them all!Enviromental Kills are cool and sometimes hilarious  Contracts mode let's you create your own unique levels and publish them for others to enjoy and rate Replay Value Cons:  Gun customization is only enabled in contracts mode and not in the single player campaign which is absolutely ridiculous. The storyline has really nothing to do with the essence of Agent 47 or his personal traits. he suddenly grows emotions, like empathy which you would not expect from a cold hearted killer like 47. The game itself is linear and just feels like "Alright, go from this point, kill some bad guys, go to this place aaaand cutscene". In Conclusion Hitman: Absolution‚Ñ¢ is a good game. not a great game, but certainly not a bad one either. it's a fresh breath of air to the series, mainly because it's completely different than the previous games - which is both a blessing and a curse. I give  Hitman: Absolution‚Ñ¢ : 7.5/10  For more recommendations and reviews on our favourite up and coming quality games follow Lot's O Giveaway's group curations here

This is one of the most tragic, touching, beautiful and story rich games you can ever play.We are not talking about COD and Battlefield conveyor, this is a real masterpiece.Pros:- visually beautiful style;- unique gameplay;- non linear and butterfly effect rich game;- soundtrack is well fitting;- story is deep and touching AF;- interesting achievements;Cons:- depression after touching story T_T;- kinda short...It isnt I just wanted more;- some people inevitably die T_T;Overall:This is a must have game, dont even hesitate to buy it during sales!

Before you buy the game please check this review and youtube videos to clarify what this game is.First of all, I wanted to say that I am absolutely in love with this game and recommending it.It has everything I want from the games: amazing soundtracks, difficult choices to be made, great looking visual effects/graphics and a lore to be explored.Short prehistory: Mother (player) is leading her army (daughters) against evil forces (The others) which trying to torture and then destroy the world.There are 5 main things you need to know about this game:1. you will fall and will be destroyed just to rise again even stronger;2. you will be forced to make hard choices such as sacrificing your daughters for the greater good;3. timeline and your position on the battlefield are the keys to victory;4. game will punish you for every mistake you made;5. there is autosave only1. you will fall and will be destroyed just to rise again even stronger;Yes, that is correct. The game wants you to fail just to follow the path of the phoenix such as "you give everything you have got, you die and you become even stronger after rebirth". This rebirth can be activated manually (next recollection) or automatically when all of your daughters were killed (same recollection mechanic).The next recollection will reset everything you have achieved except remembrances bonuses (for example, +15% of health for all daughters), special currency for buying remembrances and 3 strongest of your alive daughters. Also, last 32 dead daughters will be saved in resurrect chamber to be revived for special in game coins.2. you will be forced to make hard choices such as sacrificing your daughters for the greater good;This is the main idea of the game: you have to sacrifice daughters to win a battle and this war. This sacrifice can be made by:- holding the enemies to let other daughters and/or bright soul escape- sacrificing daughter to heal another daughter (there are no other way to heal daughters in nightmare mode)By doing the sacrifice you are not just healing daughter but also give her part of her sister power called traits (for example +532 HP and +1% of evasion). So as mentioned in item #1 by each loss you become stronger.3. timeline and your position on the battlefield are the keys to victory;The timeline in this game is dynamic and each move/attack/ability might change the order of turns and possible outcome of the fight. Your daughters are always outnumbered (sometimes 4 or 5 times) and sometimes outgunned (enemies are stronger) on the battlefield. This are your main disadvantages. In order to defeat your enemies you should:- keep your daughters united and enemies separated to face it one by one or wave by wave (use terrain features and timeline management);- analyze each your move and keep an eye on enemy attack range;- remember that each hit your daughters take will move you closer to a hard choice of sacrifice.4. game will punish you for every mistake you made;As mentioned in previous items, each action has a consequence; each hit will move you closer to a needed sacrifice; each death of your daughters will lower your army number. So keep that in mind when you play this game of thrones scenario;5. there is autosave onlyAction has consequences and you cannot escape it by shutting down game and reloading last save. Every move you make, every action you do will be registered for the only one goal: to face the outcome of your choices.

Aspect Rating   Gameplay 9/10   Story 2/10   Graphics 9/10   Sound 6/10   Optimization 6/10   Overall 6/10üëç Pros: üëç Soulcalibur game for PC is a pros for itself; Beautiful stages and highly detailed fighters; Ability to customize base characters (from colour to new outfits); New gamemode called Libra of Souls; Guest heroes upcomming.üëé Cons: üëé Amount of fighters is pretty low; Customization options are not enough; Story of characters and canonical issues; Soundtracks are not catchy.Now lets discuss those cons: Amount of fighters is pretty low;If you are a fan of Soulcalibur III, IV and V you will be very dissapointed. There are no memorable characters like Amy, Cassandra, Setsuka, Hong Yun-seong and some others. Customization options are not enough;There are literraly 10 options in each section. Moreover, some of those are locked and you have to buy it with ingame currency. As a fan of Soulcalibur games I can affirm that this is the worst Soulcalibur customization menu ever! Story of characters and canonical issues;Lets be honest this is an AAA game for 60$. For that price you expect something good, right? Well there is a problem with that. First of all, there are no cutscenes. All you can see is changing from time to time pictures with avatars of heroes. Voice acting for some characters is awful (I am speaking of eng localization). In addition to that, sometime characters are showing wrong expressions (like in Groh story then his friend Curtis is screaming but avatar is smiling Oo).But the most strange thing is that nightmare is now an evil version of Siegfried! WTF Namco?! He is supposed to be his father but no we are supposed to impress auditory of our game...Lets make something veeeeery strange, right Namco?Final rating and recommendation for/against buying game:Final rating: Game is beautiful and colourful but with those cons I can conclude that at this current build of the game I am very dissapointed.Recommendation for/against buying game: I cannot recommend this game to be bought (even If I wanted to). My suggestion is to wait 3-4 months to see if the situation was changed and hen reconsider that.

- First impressions:finally, RDR2 without boring single player, and for only 4.5 buckswait.. stop. 120 GB for DETACHED ONLINE? WHAT?- Main review:- The technical side of the game:So, I played a little and can supplement my review. I can tell right away that I am impressed with the download speed online, it is much faster than in GTA5. And also, I was not thrown out ten times when trying to connect, did the rockstar do a tremendous job and fix their sh*tty servers?UPD. A few days later I found out that they hadn't fixed the servers. To go online I have to use vpn. THANKS.There are big problems with the sound, nothing is heard at all. And there is no way to fix it.UPD. The sound must be adjusted in the Windows mixer.You can go to the settings only after creating a character and viewing the intro. But I want to do it right away!- A little about the pc version:Since I came here from the console version of the game. I will also give my opinion about the PC version itself, and not just online.Finally i can play with unlocked frame rate.Vast selection of graphical options for fine tuning your desired experience.Increased draw distance.Overall improved textures.HDR support and up to 3840 x 2160 resolution support.Ultra wide and multi-monitor setup support.- Content:Grind, grind, grind.Monetizing Red Dead Online has become even more aggressive. For example, for completing a Battle Pass worth 40 gold bars, you can only get 30 bars - that is, you have to donate again to buy the next season pass.In modern service games like Apex Legends, Call of Duty, and Fortnite, players not only return all investments, but also increase them when fully completing the Premium Pass branch. For example, a Call of Duty subscription costs 1000 coins, and you can get 1400 coins for completing a season.In addition, starting today in Red Dead Online, the reward multiplier for completing Daily Challenges resets at 28 days, after which you have to start all over again. At the same time, prices for premium projects are gradually increasing.- Conclusion:I think this can be done. Rockstars are just trying to siphon all the money from their players without offering anything in return. 4 bucks game, of course, is worth it. For a couple of weeks here you can have fun with friends, and then abandon the game. After all, you did not give the full price, so it's not a pity.

You can consider me quite impressionable, but for me personally this game was so deeply remembered and caused a storm of emotions after passing (I mean the final scenes) that I was a little taken aback and did not start another game for 2 more days after completion, digesting the plot and events unfolding in it ... and also wanted to go through another - a bad ending, which I will soon do.Developers so professionally instill in the player an affection for (open and prescribed) characters that you can unwittingly listen to their conversations, which can sometimes last for 4-5 minutes !! (and I haven‚Äôt met this yet) and empathize, worry or support them in monologues (yes, Artyom‚Äôs voice has not yet been delivered, Gordon Freeman sends his regards).The developed and almost open world in some large locations is very impressive, accessible to the player to research, search for loot and improve equipment and weapons, random encounters and search for notes and tapes for understanding the plot as a whole, etc.It used to be fun to watch comparisons between STALKER and METRO.I always understood that the first is huge open locations, open lands and so on, and the second is linear corridors and tunnels and that it‚Äôs simply impossible to compare these games ...But with the release of Exodus, you realize that here is as spiritually Stalkera as possible. But not about that.+ I liked the customization of the weapon and its presentation itself. The body kit of trunks and the improvement of Artyom‚Äôs suit are elegantly presented and woven into the mechanics; almost all of them are clearly worth the time spent searching for them.+ Gorgeous traced locations. Very atmospheric. Winter on the Volga River, the dried Caspian Sea with rotting hulls of ships and shacks, rotting their age, autumn Taiga with beautiful forests and rivers and the Dead, abandoned winter city, which only drives you almost depresnyak, from its doom, "grayness" and hopelessness+ Excellently expanded bestiardia of monsters.+ Interaction with characters is simply incomparable. The game crashes pretty well into the brain and evokes emotions, I haven‚Äôt been so impressed with the history of people who often want to help ... and you do it over and over again.+ Graphics. Everything is on top for me. Weapons, landscapes, and room interiors are well designed: bunkers, abandoned huts, tunnels of abandoned metro, etc.+ I really liked how the navigation is presented in the form of a tablet with a map and current tasks.Compass on hand, Geiger counter, Artyom detection sensor in the dark, etc. All this is very well implemented and the main thing is not meaningless.+ Train Aurora. A wonderful and atmospheric hub for the player to take a break from long explorations of the world and dangerous zones. Get to know the characters better, get high from the interior of the equipped wagons, listen to music and talk on the radio waves of unfamiliar survivors among themselves, smoke a cigarette and have a little thump ...You can still write a lot about the pros of the game, I found a huge number of them, but I just recommend buying this wonderful product to every player.Despite the publisher‚Äôs idiotic policy, it wasn‚Äôt worth underestimating the ratings of the previous parts in this way - this is primarily stupid and stupid. They gave us a great series and maybe! already regretted the transfer of the game to EGS, but there was no turning back ... In the reviews of previous games, frat is a bad deed, I think.The game deserves the highest praise for me, and I recommend it to everyone for passing.

I have been playing counter strike for about 2 years. I have put about 200 hours in CS:GO but only 20 in CS:S. I own CS 1.6 and CS Condition Zero but have not played them. Over the years I have found this game great. It is endless fun with friends and even by yourself. There are endless gamemodes and community items,stickers,maps, and servers. But there are some problems with the game. Here is a list of them....CONSVAC is not banning cheaters like it used to, this is because they have found away around the system so it is common to encounter a hacker in MM.64 tik servers which are not so great when playing against people with 200+ pingMM could do better with who gets put with who and smurfs.Nerfs are either inefficient or pointless (like the tec-9 nerf) or they hurt the game (AWP movement nerf)But at the same time there are a lot of pros about this game...PROSEnjoyment to the end with friends and by yourselfCompetitive games for the person who likes to be speaking and communicating to teammatesOnce you buy the game has no must buy in-game purchasesSkill based gameplay and tactics not run-and-gun (Call of Duty)A game that will last a long long timeOverall this game is a timeless game that will take a while before the game will die. Confesso que quando vi este jogo pela primeira vez, joguei por poucos minutos, e rotulei como mais um joguinho retr√¥, arcade sobre SCORES que n√£o renderia mais que duas horas. Hoje jogando com mais profundidade, tive a prazerosa descoberta que se trata de um rogue-like de personalidade, desafiador e com mais conte√∫do do que eu imaginava.Logo no menu percebe-se a grande variedade de modos de jogo, dungeons, desafios, triais, e at√© um incr√≠vel jogo de cartas, inspirado em Triple Triad do Final Fantasy. Esse conte√∫do √© desbloquado a medida que voc√™ supera esses desafios, bem variados por sinal, desde fugir duma dungeon sem arma ou jogar na completa escurid√£o. E o melhor, tudo de maneira procedural.A sua habilidade √© um fator determinante para a progress√£o do jogo, e claro, sorte no que voc√™ coleta aleat√≥riamente nas runs. N√£o existe atributos fixos para upar, facilitando as pr√≥ximas tentativas, e isso torna tudo mais desafiador e satisfat√≥rio. Existem 9 personagens, com pequenas diferen√ßas de gameplay, mas que alteram muito a maneira de se jogar.Um √≥timo jogo, pixel art nost√°lgica, trilha sonora com pegada bem cl√°ssicos da SEGA, e com um carinhoso easter egg do Super Mario. N√£o conhecia o trabalho do Caiysware, √© um dev muito aut√™ntico, extremamente atencioso com sua comunidade, e atualiza seus jogos com frequ√™ncia.

Acompanho desde early access em fevereiro de 2018, periodicamente jogo 3/4 partidas pra ver como esta, houve um grande avan√ßo em termos de otimiza√ß√£o, por√©m no geral poucas novidades e mesmo passados 3 anos  ainda sofre dos mesmos problemas... ‚úîÔ∏è Os gr√°ficos s√£o impressionantes, o n√≠vel de detalhes dos cen√°rios √© absurdo, voc√™ percebe que cada local recebeu muita aten√ß√£o, e isso vale para personagens, monstros e itens. Cada ambiente, tanto interno como externo, possuem tra√ßos muito caracter√≠sticos. Existe um "gloss√°rio" interessante com a lore das armas, criaturas e locais.‚úîÔ∏è A ambienta√ß√£o √© muito acima da m√©dia para um jogo competitivo, Crytek fez um trabalho surreal neste aspecto, a imers√£o √© insana, melhor que muito AAA. Ao movimentar-se, cada part√≠cula do mapa emite efeitos sonoros responsivos e interagem com cada movimento. √â impressionante observar o personagem esgueirando em meio a vegeta√ß√£o, esbarrando em uma garrafa ou o rangir da madeira ao caminhar.  A sistem√°tica mesclando PVP/PVE tamb√©m √© um dos seus destaques. Mesmo entregando esses fatores com excel√™ncia, na minha opini√£o n√£o sustentam um jogo focado em PVP. Hunt: Showdown se tornou caro, com uma comunidade pequena, principalmente na Am√©rica do Sul.‚ùå A maior parte das partidas sofri com ping alto. O sistema de busca desloca quem joga da Am√©rica do Sul para a regi√£o secund√°ria. Ao selecionar apenas SA como regi√£o de busca, o resultado √© muita demora. Formar grupo com amigos pode ser mais r√°pido, por√©m com o grande risco de cair em partidas vazias. Falando nisso, n√£o tem como saber quando se esta sozinho. Voc√™ pode estar jogando da forma mais t√°tica poss√≠vel, numa partida apenas com NPC's. Talvez seja o tal "hardcore" que dizem.‚ùå  O desbalanceamento √© evidente, jogadores novatos/experientes nas mesmas partidas, e n√£o estou falando de free for all ou casual, √© Matchmaking mesmo. A falta de divis√£o de rank, talvez seja pela car√™ncia de jogadores. Como era de se esperar o novo sistema de pareamento de partidas por n√≠vel de habilidade da Att 16/04/21, apenas deixou ainda mais demorado encontrar partidas, e mesmo ativado eventualmente acaba n√£o funcionando.‚ùå Vejo um potencial gigantesco disperdi√ßado em rela√ß√£o a PVE/COOP, o mapa permite muitas possibilidades, poderiam investir em modos desafiadores, como defender hordas de monstros buscando abrigos em casas, capturar itens etc. Isso consequentemente fortaleceria a comunidade, conquistando novos jogadores.‚ùå Ainda que rode melhor que no beta, falta ajustes, como ao iniciar ou sair de uma partida, a tela de loading simplesmente congela todo seu computador por um longo tempo, e nem ALT+TAB salva. Falta sistema de notifica√ß√£o ao encontrar partidas, voc√™ √© obrigado a vegetar na tela de busca, ou corre o risco de perder o grupo.‚ùå O estopim para escrever esta an√°lise, foi o que aconteceu recentemente. Tive a infelicidade de ser expulso de partidas pelo anti-cheat tr√™s vezes seguidas! Foi somente nesse dia, mas em tempos de banimentos gratuitos, isso √© preocupante. O mais engra√ßado √© que o hack come solto. Infelizmente n√£o posso recomendar esse jogo, principalmente pra quem joga SA. Pode ser divertido jogar esporadicamente com amigos, mas a longo prazo, fica vis√≠vel que esses problemas v√£o atrapalhar sua jogatina. Um jogo inconsistente, desbalanceado e relativamente caro at√© o momento. Crytek foi ambiciosa em basicamente duplicar o pre√ßo ap√≥s o lan√ßamento, acredito que isso espantou grande parte de jogadores. Uma pena, esta engatinhando a 3 anos com um jogo que poderia facilmente estar em outro patamar. Espero que melhore e futuramente eu possa refazer essa an√°lise positivamente.

Re-VoltGame is old but a classic. But it's also kind of broken, however, still playable. Only issues I had was gamepad configurations and stuck in first place requiring race restart.Main reason I wanted it was for a classic addition to my library for nostalgic reasons and for my Steam Deck. Like I said it's a little broken. Yes, this is playable on Steam Deck just fine on Proton 5.13-6 setting. Otherwise you will get a viewpoint error when launching the game. Controls however don't work out of the box, I used a community layout and has fixed most problems.

Kanjozoku Game „É¨„Éº„Çµ„ÉºAlright, I'll be honest I was quite intrigued with the game because the Devs used Underground 1 Song on the trailer. Visually it looked pretty good for my tastes.As far as what I have played, I can say the state of the game is playable and can get casual enjoyment out of it. Yes, quite rough for what it is right now, however, the structure is there and believe this game has lot's of potential.Optimization on my main rig, I had no problems with 100% scaling. On my Steam Deck, I have also played this on does run it averagely well, but not butter smooth. I'll have another section for this later.For what the game gives you, several cars, plenty of upgrades. Both Performance and Body Work. Let's not forget Stance and Wraps as well. The game does have a good Eurobeat vibe. You have a Highway course, which unfortunately is one way and no exits. I hope this changes. You can race with other people, though, traffic is not sync with other racers. There's police as well, simply you just outrun them or get busted. This is a challenge at first because you're slow, of course.The game does become more enjoyable the more upgrades you put on. I for sure hope for more of a progression system.For what the game is and price, not too bad. Definitely improvements can be made. I'll be following this for sure for future updates.Steam Deck Verification.Going to assume very few playing this on the Steam Deck as of right now. I figured to give it a try. Performance-wise it's pretty average. At 80% scaling you can get a Solid 60fps experience for the most part. Though, some dips to 52 that are short-drops do happen here and there. Game is playable however. 100% Scaling you go down to 42FPS with the same problem with the 80% scaling. 40Hz lock, it does stay close to 40fps. At times it would do a micro-drop to 38fps.Controls work out of the Community Layout. I have used this game on the Xbox S controller of mine on the Desktop, I had no problems.Biggest problem I am running into however. No Cross-Sync on your progress. You restart from the beginning from a different device. This should be addressed. Personally not a huge deal for me, I'll play this more on my Desktop. However, it would be nice to play it in bed or on the couch for a casual session. So I'm not given an option here. Surely some can relate.Overall I'll rate the experience Playable. Verified once those minor issues are addressed.
Gonna be honest...I just wanted the RJuman emojis and had to background this.

Neon WhiteOkay, I can see why this game is absolute hype.A good Speed-Running game with mix of FPS formula. I had no hype, actually, no idea about this game until now. It's actually pretty good. Soundtrack also slaps.Dialogue is pretty cringe but honestly I think it really makes it comical more than anything, it's nothing too serious. So don't expect much of a story. Gameplay however makes up for it.
A nice refreshing experience from the classics.A true chad game indeed.

The Crew‚Ñ¢ 2It's actually an ((alright)) game from Ubisoft. Though, you can still tell it's a Ubisoft game by how lazy and cookie-cutter the map placement is. However, the gameplay is quite fun and relaxing as you put Spotify or any app to play some tunes. This game is not a simulator, nor an arcade-sim. It's pure arcade with silly physics. Lot to explore, fair amount of content, decent amount of vehicle selections and unique choices of driving a plane and a boat. Though, the core aspect of the game shifted to focus on cars more as they were favored compared to the other two. Don't expect much of a story (Which racing games lack anyways) and good dialogue. It's really just cliche social media garbage that can be overlooked.You could compare Forza and The Crew 2. Forza is the obvious winner here. But The Crew 2 is fun and unique in it's own way. The Forza elitists will seethe and disagree when reading this. Get some friends, do races, explore, it's quite an enjoyable experiences.Would this game be worth it full price? Honestly I'd argue no. Yes, I do think the game is fun but the quality of it is really a night and day difference with Forza. There ARE some customization for vehicles, however, not at NFS level. I've personally gotten the Gold version for $30 and pretty satisfied with it. As this being a Ubisoft game, I have to say the support on this game is pretty good. New cars and content always added. The game is unfortunately Online Only based. It's heavily relied with Online services.TL;DR: Overall pretty decent Ubisoft title. Pure arcade, despite Forza being better in quality, this game can be fun in it's own ways especially with friends or just to vibe to with Spotify in the background.

Fallout 4 Nuka-WorldPretty decent expansion, probably better when on sale, there's definitely a lot of quirks. Game actually doesn't force you to be a raider. You can literally off the raiders at any point (would recommend towards the end of the DLC) and free the slaves. Baffles me what these reviews are talking about. Some are justified, most are just exaggerated.Even with a Minutemen playthrough, it was not conflicted when I chose to free the slaves. Yes, you can work with the raiders to free the park, however, as I already mentioned, you can off all of them at the end when they want to take over the commonwealth. Don't see the problem here. You're given a choice of what you want to do.I would mostly recommend this DLC for the exploration, weapons, and just a new location to explore just like Far Harbor. Don't expect much as of a good story.
Yes

Dying Light 2 Stay HumanI've been looking forward to the next chapter of the Dying Light Series. For the first two hours, I'm quite satisfied. Though, I do wish Dunovo was not included. Fortunately, I have not run into any problems yet. 1440p on High Settings with my 5700XT. The only change I made was disabling motion-blur.Things I liked:I do enjoy the location that was picked, especially from the start of the game. A nice introduction and references about previous events, backstories of how the infection happened. I'm not expecting much of a story, but so far I think it's been alright. Some of the character details are just amazing.Combat is a subjective topic. I'm pretty neutral with the combat. It certainly takes time to get used to. I think the Human x Human combat is much more engaging compared to the first Dying Light.The parkour aspect is also a subjective topic. Just as I mentioned about the combat, it does take time to get used to. It honestly was a bit frustrating at first in some segments. I'm pretty neutral about the change. This is subject to change in the future as I unlock more perks.Things I don't like:As for as I played, Night-time isn't as dark as the first Dying Light. Do note I'm on my first night, I'm not sure if it's just the reflection of the Moon itself, I was disappointed by how light it is when exploring at the night.Dunovo. Why did you add this?No weapon repair? At least what I'm aware of, there is no weapon repair system.UI I'm personally not a fan of. I enjoyed what Dying Light 1 had. I feel like if you kept the same formula, it would be perfectly fine.Why can't you sprint by default? Countless times you naturally want to press Shift (or whatever control input) to run faster. I'm not much of a fan of having yourself run by default.My Experience Overall:It's aight. I think it's not the greatest nor the worst game, it's decent. The first Dying Light was jank in it's own ways too. But some of the things were done better I admit. I have not run into anything bug-related, I'll be honest. But I know they're out there. Though I'm still early in the game, I'm sure I'll run into something at one point. Performance is apparently bad, guess I'm one of the lucky ones that didn't have the problem. It's a mixed bag, there are things I wish they kept from Dying Light 1 and moved over for the second game. Meanwhile, there are some changes I like. But recommending this at $60? I didn't have many expectations and enjoyed what I played so far. I cam agree to wait for a sale if you're patient enough.If you're expecting much of a Dying Light 1 feel and don't like change, you're going to be disappointed.

Train Sim World¬Æ 2It would be great if the tutorial actually served it's purpose. Y'know...teach you how to do things. This is one thing the game does not. The tutorial does not tell you everything. Done them multiple times, and nothing carries over what you have 'learned'.If I have to sit here and lurk Steam Discussions, Read PDF files and Watch YouTube videos to actually figure out how to play the game because your tutorials don't explain everything properly in the year 2022, you did something wrong. I get it's a simulator, but this could of been done way better.Gonna have to downvote this one chief.

Der Ansatz war ziemlich gut.  2017 fing die Entwicklung an. Leider gibt es seit l√§ngerer Zeit keinen sichtbaren Fortschritt in der Entwicklung mehr. Das letzte "gro√üe" Update war Dez. 2021. Das n√§chste Update (fire ant) soll laut Support in den "n√§chsten" Monaten (Datum?) sein. Auch ein release Datum wird nicht angegeben. Im Grunde genommen kann das Spiel und dessen Entwicklung als tot angesehen werden. Spieleinhalt. Minikampagne mit 3 LevelnEinige kniffelige SzenarienFree Play Modus mit 4 festen Maps. Wird aber schnell langweilig.Die angesagten knapp 20‚Ç¨ muss jeder selbst entscheiden ob er sie daf√ºr ausgeben m√∂chte. Ich w√ºrde es nicht wieder machen.Anfagen der Community werden mit den gleichen steriotypen Antworten bedacht: Wir haben zu wenig Ressourcen, ein gutes Spiel braucht nun mal lange (5+ Jahre?), nach dem n√§chsten Update denken wir das an (Planung, Datum?), nach dem release (Datum?) werden wir dar√ºber nachdenken. Ich empfehle: Finger weg denn f√ºr den Preis bekommt man sehr gute, fertige Spiele die man dauerhaft spielen kann.
